definition: to congratulate respectfully/to express good wishes

sentences.english: I would congratulate him if my leader or elder has accomplished something.
sentences.chinese: 上級或長輩有某些成就，我會恭賀他。

sentences.english: Her French counter-part, President Nicolas Sarkozy also sent his congratulations.
sentences.chinese: 法國總統薩科齊也發出恭賀。

sentences.english: Or congratulate the newlyweds and wish them a lifetime of happiness.
sentences.chinese: 或者恭賀新人，祝福他們白頭偕老。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the national college entrance examination. I beg you to take this little gift as a souvenir.
sentences.chinese: 恭賀高考旗開得勝，奉上禮物以作紀念。

sentences.english: The report included the self-congratulatory themes that are typically present in North Korea's government statements.
sentences.chinese: 公報帶有朝鮮政府聲明特有的恭賀自己的語氣。

sentences.english: Congratulations on ten great years of business.
sentences.chinese: 恭賀十年來輝煌的業績。

sentences.english: WESTLIFE sends their congratulations to President Kim Daejung on winning the Nobel Peace prize.
sentences.chinese: 西城男孩向金大中主席恭賀他獲得諾貝爾和平獎。

sentences.english: It was sent to the court, accompanied by a memorial of felicitation to the throne.7
sentences.chinese: 連同一封恭賀登基的請願書，它被送往朝廷。

sentences.english: I am here tonight to wish your club a happy birthday.
sentences.chinese: 今晚恭賀貴俱樂部週年慶。

sentences.english: Best wishes for your new home, came to congratulate the people sitting for desk.
sentences.chinese: 喬遷之喜，前來恭賀的人坐了幾十桌。

sentences.english: Congratulations on the arrival of your baby.
It's appropriate to congratulate new parents on their new addition.
sentences.chinese: 向生嬰兒的父母親恭賀新生兒也是合宜的。

sentences.english: But economists say it may still be too early to congratulate him on rescuing the economy.
sentences.chinese: 但是，經濟學家指出，恭賀他挽救美國經濟爲時尚早。

definition: member of a board of directors
anniversary of the founding of a school
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
to make a speech/to make some remarks
